alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 20 at 8:49PM AKST until November 21 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINTER STORM WILL CONTINUE TO IMPACT THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE PANHANDLE ... As of 8 pm, snow reports from around Southeast Alaska have ranged from 6 to 21 inches with this system. The rain-snow will steadily move north through the night with major accumulations ending by morning for all but the far northern inner channels. High winds in downtown Juneau will persist overnight, resulting in continued blizzard conditions there. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. We have received reports of around 12-16 inches in the Gustavus and Pelican areas. * WHERE...Glacier Bay, Eastern Chichagof Island and Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay
